intro: Excoecaria mauritiana, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from red to yellow. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and moist forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks in warm regions.
